2. Iterate through each edge in the graph, updating the distance array as we go. If there is an edge connecting node i to node j with a lower distance than what is currently stored in distance[j], update distance[j] with the new lower value.
3. If you reach node 4 while iterating through the graph, you have found a path from node 0 to node 4, and you can stop the algorithm. Otherwise, if you reach a node for which all edges have been visited without reaching node 4, that node cannot be part of the shortest path, so you can ignore it.
